meanings.definition: To make or become wider or larger in size.
meanings.sent1: She used a special tool to dilater the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The baker needed to dilater the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to dilater the box, but it ended up shrinking instead!
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to dilater his whole face with joy.
meanings.sent5: The balloon started to dilater as more air was blown into it.

meanings.sent1: They had to dilater the meeting due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The student decided to dilater studying for the exam until the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dilater the inevitable bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The decision to dilater the project only added to the stress.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped dilater the need for watering the garden.
